title: Factor into Primes
text: Factor each coefficient into primes and write the variables with exponents in expanded form. A prime number is a counting number greater than $$1$$, whose only factors are $$1$$ and itself. The first few prime numbers are: $$2$$, $$3$$, $$5$$, $$7$$, $$11$$, $$13$$, etc.
speech: Factor each coefficient into primes and write the variables with exponents in expanded form. A prime number is a counting number greater than  1 , whose only factors are  1  and itself. The first few prime numbers are:  2 ,  3 ,  5 ,  7 ,  11 ,  13 , etc.
pacedSpeech: Factor each coefficient into primes and write the variables with exponents in expanded form. A prime number is a counting number greater than   1
and itself. The first few prime numbers are:   2

title: Factor First Expression
text: $$8a^2 b^3=2\times2\times2 a a b b b$$
speech: 8 a squared b cubed is equal to, 2 times 2 times 2 aabbb
math: $$8a^2 b^3=2\times2\times2 a a b b b$$

title: Factor Second Expression
speech: 10 a b squared, is equal to, 5 times 2 a b b
pacedSpeech: 10 a b squared, is equal to, 5 times 2 a b b

title: Identify Common Factors in each Column
text: $$8a^2 b^3=2\times2\times2 a a b b b$$\n$$10a b^2=5\times2 a b b$$\n$$2$$, a, $$b$$, and $$b$$ are shared by both expressions.
speech: 8 a squared b cubed is equal to 2 times 2 times 2 aabbb \n, 10 a b squared is equal to 5 times 2 a b b \n 2 , a,  b , and  b  are shared by both expressions.

title: Multiply Common Factors
text: Bring down the $$2$$, a, $$b$$, and $$b$$, and then multiply.\n$$GCF=2a b b$$
